entry.title: Opportunité à pourvoir - Proposition d'un CDI chez un client final
entry.content:
Bonjour à tous,
Je recherche un technico fonctionnel SAP SD pour un CDI chez un client final basé à la Défense - MM serait un plus - Anglais impératif - un profil technique en lien avec les différentes entités du groupe dans le monde. Déplacements occasionnels envisageables.  Pour plus d'informations me contacter et m'adresser votre email pour recevoir la fiche de poste. Au plaisir de faire votre connaissance. Brigitte - bchemel@capest-conseils.com

Je vais rechercher également des profils EWM et SCM. Faites vous connaitre

entry.title: Invoice Split Issue
entry.content:
Hello, 

I am facing an issue while invoice creation, actually it should not split an invoice, but it is splitting and the reason for the split are custom fields, but we did not right any custom logic to split. VBRK-ZUKRI is same for both the invoices but still 2 invoices created.

Regards,

Ravi Seela

entry.title: BOP is not working for MTO scenerio
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a requirement for MTO scenario(Strategy group B6) where the BOP is not confirming the sales order even after the planned order is firmed. 

Expectation is that we need automated process (Batch job) where once the planned order is confirmed, sales order should get confirmed based on BOP run.

Please note when we do manual availability check in sales order, it works.

In the BOP settings, we are using the strategy "Improve" as the business need is that we want the order confirmation based on First Come First Serve basis.

Can you share your input on this?

With Regards

Vinu Nanjan

entry.title: SD: Exclusão do ICMS-ST da base de cálculo do PIS e COFINS
entry.content:
Olá,

Recebemos a solicitação de implementação de solução em SD da exclusão do ICMS-ST da base de cálculo do PIS e do COFINS.

Pesquisando aqui só encontramos a KBA (3085964 - ICMS Exclusion from PIS and COFINS Base Amount (TAXBRA)) que implementa a exclusão do ICMS na BADI BADI_J1B_EXTEND_TAXES.

Alguém aqui já implementou alguma solução standard para a exclusão do ICMS-ST da base de cálculo do PIS e do COFINS?

Muito obrigado!

entry.title: Restrict User from creating back date invoice for specific billing type in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
We have a requirement in "Create Billing Document" (VF01 Tcode) to restrict the user from entering the back date for a specific billing type while generating the billing document.

Need support here.

entry.title: SAP S/4 - Migration ECC to S/4 - Downgrade the Idoc version
entry.content:
Hello Experts.

We have done a migration from ECC to S/4 and we are facing an issue as below.

There are different release numbers of SHPMNT05 IDocs between ECC and S/4. This causes a big trouble in the EDI server, because the XML structure of IDoc defined by the “parser” file has also changed.

There are two release numbers 750 (ECC) and 758 (S/4). 

The main issue is different parser file e.g. WE60 (F9) and on the XML structure file

Could you please give us some advice if we have some possibility to change the release number back to 750 or the downgrade is possible?

Regards,

Leonardo Delgado

entry.title: VK13 issue
entry.content:
In reference to the post of Mr. Palanisami on 2007 Apr 25 12:19 PM, I found no solution was provided that time. Could you all please check once. My issue is

For a condition type, there are 5 different accesses. For the first access, there are 5 selection fields. We have stored a condition record for this first access. When we use VK13 and enter the field values for first key, we can see the condition record.

But when we use VK13 and press "Condition Info" tab on the top, it has to display all the condition records for this condition type (i.e. for all the accesses). But it is not showing the record that we created for the first key. Actual problem is that when we click "Condition Info", one of the fields for the first key is not displayed at all.

Another strange thing is that this issue occurs only in production system and not found in development and test systems.

Your help will be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: freight cost from sales order to delivery
entry.content:
Hello SAP Team,

My client has a requirement to notify the shipping department when a freight cost is added to a sales order.

This must be done by adding a value like 0,01 to the freight cost in the sales order. When the shipping department will see 0,01 in the outbound delivery, they will know that a freight cost must be added to the outbound delivery.

I know that the standard SAP does not support copying the value a freight cost to a delivery note but does anyone here have a solution? Or ever had a requirement like this before?

Thanks 

Thanks

entry.title: OUTB Delivery - Picking Request Doc do not confirm
entry.content:
Hi...

for some reason I can't figure out, I can't complete the Picking Request Document.

We have a system that creates a Sales Order and a Outb. Delivery. We have 2 scenarios...

1 - an Employee must pick the item itself and do the picking manually using the Pick Outbound Delivery app. This works fine..

2 - A customer pick an item directly from the shelf, so when the Sales Order + Outb. Dlvr are created, Picking and PGI should be automatically created.

Here's my issue on the second scenario... I'm not being able to complete the Picking Request Document, so the Picking Status is B, instead of C. [IMG 1]

And the Picking Request stays as "Open" [IMG 2]

I tried to use FM WS_DELIVERY_UPDATE, but I only get the error that the Piking Request is not completed. VL E 618.

If I try to pass the number of items in VBPOK_TAB, I get the error that the confirmed qty and the picked qty are different for the amount of the items..

I still can change the status to C if I manually do it on VL02N, but it does not call a BAPI or any other FM. [IMG 3]

any thoughts on how to make it work?

entry.title: aATP Product Substitution based on Material and Plant
entry.content:
Looking for expert comments on aATP Product Substitution in the SAP S/4HANA 2021 system:

1. Assume that each plant (Plant 1, Plant 2, etc.) has Product A as the original material and Product B as its substitute. 

2. Now aATP should first check Plant 1 for the availability of Product A. If not available, it should continue checking sequentially through Plant 2, Plant 3, Plant 4, and Plant 5, all for Product A.

3. If a partial quantity of Product A is available in Plant 1, aATP should consider that quantity to confirm and then check the remaining quantity in Plant 2, and so on. It should continue checking all plants until the full requirement is fulfilled with Product A.

4. If Product A is not available in any of the five plants, aATP should then consider Product B as the substitute, starting from the plant where the order was created. It should check Plant 1 for Product B, followed by Plant 2, Plant 3, Plant 4, and Plant 5, in the same sequence.

I know there is BAPI available in 2023 and possible, looking for the way out in case of S4HANA 2021.

Any suggest, please?

entry.title: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe Form (SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN) in SAP S/4HANA Publi
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are working in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition, 3-System Landscape) and using the standard billing form SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN.

Currently, in the billing document PDF we are getting only the cumulative GST value. The business requirement is to show CGST, SGST, and IGST separately in the Adobe form.
       

  • How can we extend the standard form to bring in CGST, SGST, and IGST values?

  • Is there any standard way to fetch these fields or do we need backend logic to split cumulative GST into CGST/SGST/IGST?

  • Are there any blogs, KBAs, or SAP Help documents that explain how to extend SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN for India GST scenarios?

      If anyone has already implemented this, please suggest the correct approach or point me to a reference blog/document.

Thanks in advance,
Sanjay

entry.title: how to take return for damaged SFG and RM material back against FG material sale
entry.content:
Reuirment is - take the return of damaged SFG & RM materials back  in quality inspection storage location against sale of FG material and will raise FOC for same . FG material is assembled with many SGF and RM material types , in transit , it got damaged ,now customer wants replacement only for damaged parts which could be SFG and RM which he will replace in his place since delivery is handled by Business 

Please help to identify the correct process and config steps

entry.title: S/4 - Open Sales Order Report with Partialy Deliveries
entry.content:
Hi, Everyone!.   I'm looking for guidance on how best to support a business requirement to have a sales open order report which takes into account partial deliveries.   List of Sales Orders does not have the ability to include delivery quantity so I'm leaning towards creating a custom analytical query, however, this is proving to be challenging as the available data cubes do not seem to contain the delivered quantity information.   Has anyone developed a similar report?   Does anyone have an advice on how to create the custom analytical query?   Appreciate your time!!  

SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Considerations on multiple Distribution Channels (and Divisions) in SD Org. Structure
entry.content:
Hi, this is a common topic when designing the SD org. structure - we usually try to limit the number of Distribution Channels and Divisions to avoid redundant maintenance of customer and material master data in the sales view.

However, let's assume a case where we need to create 5 distribution channels (Wholesale, Retail, Online, etc.), but we don’t want to maintain thousands of material master records/sales views separately for each channel, especially since there’s no difference from the material perspective. Still, materials should be available via all channels in sales docs.

On the other hand, we do need to maintain customer master data for a certain distribution channel - due to specific master data, sales document settings, reporting, authorizations, etc.

It seems that the "common distribution channel" functionality, for some reason, can’t be used here because it’s not possible to define a common channel for the material master only.
(Similarly, it would be great if we could define a common division for customer master data only, but again... it's not possible).

Do you have any ideas or real-life examples from your projects on how to handle such cases?

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply Chain in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (web-based Fiori apps, though standard TCodes like MMBE are still available).

Here’s the scenario:

  1. Using MMBE, suppose we have 10,000 stock available.

  2. Multiple salesmen are creating sales orders, deliveries, posting PGI, and invoices.

  3. Sometimes, one user leaves the process incomplete (e.g., delivery created but invoice not done).

  4. After PGI, stock reduces in the system (e.g., from 10,000 → 5,000). However, when we check physical stock, it shows a mismatch (e.g., 6,000 physically available).

  5. This causes stock visibility and accountability issues for the supply chain team.

Requirement:
Instead of Sales doing PGI, we want to shift PGI responsibility to the Supply Chain team. This way, stock movement is fully controlled and monitored by them, avoiding mismatches and conflicts.

My question:

  • Is there a way in S/4HANA Public Cloud to restrict PGI so that only the Supply Chain team can execute it (not Sales)?

  • If yes, what’s the best practice or standard way to achieve this?

Thanks in advance for your guidance.
